labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides tools for managing Google Tasks, allowing users to create, list, update, delete, and toggle the completion status of tasks. It integrates task management capabilities into applications or LLM workflows, focusing on productivity and task organization through a structured interface.
labels.reasoning: The **Daily Productivity** label is chosen because the server's primary function is task management, which aligns with personal and work productivity. The **API Integration** label is selected as a secondary label due to its integration capabilities with Google Tasks. No custom label is needed as the functionality fits well within the predefined categories.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Google Tasks Server
server_info_crawled.author: @erik-gunnarsson/mcp-google-tasks
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your Google Tasks efficiently through a structured MCP server interface. Create, list, update, delete, and toggle task completion seamlessly using standardized tools. Integrate task management capabilities directly into your applications or LLM workflows.

tools.name: create_task
tools.description: Deploy Server Google Tasks Server @erik-gunnarsson/mcp-google-tasks Try in Playground create_task

tools.name: list_tasks
tools.description: List all tasks in the default task list

tools.name: delete_task
tools.description: Delete a task from the default task list

tools.name: complete_task
tools.description: Toggle the completion status of a task

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@erik-gunnarsson/mcp-google-tasks/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
